data.title: Nice Place
data.text: The only problem was that there is no Wheelchair access.  We brought our sister who move around in an electric wheelchair and was not able to go in.

data.title: Great history lesson!
data.text: I must preface this with I was a history major so this is right up my alley.  Our daughter moved to Hawaii 6 years ago and has been instrumental in us learning the history and respecting the culture of the Hawaiian people.  This palace only solidifies that experience.  It's beautiful, progressive and sad all in one.  Hawaii is one of our states, and we should learn the history of this community as well.  It's reasonably priced and packed full of information.  Because of this tour, we found more places that we will have to return to visit on Oahu.

data.title: Honolulu central gem
data.text:
What an impressive building with its contents and the sense of history.

I enjoyed my visit here, because it showed the Hawaiian Royalty in its glory. What amazing people!!

An hidden gem in the center of Honolulu

Please don't miss this!!

data.title: Wonderful knowledge and Aloha by our hostess
data.text: If you really wanted to imagine living in a palace and experiencing the lives of the Hawaiin Monarchy this is it. With 39 years up her sleeve and only 15 of them paid our guide was truly amazing giving us interesting facts, helping us understand the timeline, historical milestones and challenges and making us feel like ohaina for a moment in time. One of the great highlights of my stay.

data.title: Historical
data.text: An amazing sense of history at the Iolani Palace. A very educational experience learning the details of how Hawaii came to be. Definitely worth the visit!

data.title: A must see
data.text: Don't miss the chance to learn about the Hawaiian monarchy and see the beautiful restored palace. Take a guided tour. The volunteers and staff are very pleasant and helpful. Stay longer and enjoy the lovely surroundings. The State Capital is unique and beautiful. It is next door to the palace and has an open courtyard you can walk through to see the atrium. Didn't make it to the Bishop museum but heard good things about this nearby attraction.

data.title: Unexpected gem in the heart of Honolulu
data.text: Our tour of the Iolani Palace was more than what we expected. We were able to park for free on their grounds, and the staff bent over backwards to accommodate our changing schedule. The guide was very knowledgeable and made the Hawaiian history come to life for us. The palace was beautifully furnished as it was in the time of the kings and queens of Hawaii.

data.title: National Treasure
data.text: I am a resident of the State, and find this such a gift to both residents & visitors.  The Palace is constantly updated and changes every time I go!  Please visit this gift as it is the only one in the United States and an experience of a truly exceptional monarchy.

data.title: Make Time for Iolani Palace!
data.text: A visit to Iolani Palace is a great way to learn more about Hawaiian history.We enjoyed the whole experience.  I would recommend making a reservation for the guided tour. We had an excellent tour guide—very knowledgeable and articulate!

data.title: Classic beauty
data.text: I have been to Honolulu 6 times and never visited here previously. The restoration is fantastic, so much history and easy to get to via The Bus, just ask the driver for the nearest stop.

data.title: Excellent
data.text: This is an awesome place to visit!  The audio tour is the best I have ever done.  It is well worth the time to visit and you do not feel rushed or crowded.  My sister and I thoroughly enjoyed our visit and highly recommend it to others if you are interested in history.

data.title: Worth it
data.text: This is the best way to get a taste of HawAiian history and the monarchy. I've been several times and never get tired of this hallowed ground!

data.title: wonderful histroy
data.text: this is a must see for everyone and the opening credits to Hawaii five-O. Now you remember. this was an awesome tour

data.title: Historical Attraction
data.text:
Very informational, interesting and entertaining. A MUST visit for all tourists, visitors and Kamaainas
that come to Honolulu. This my second visit and you always learn more facts each time that you come
here

data.title: Must see
data.text: Palace is nice to view. But, the history of the palace was very thought provoking.  It highlights the background of how Hawaii became a state. Nice exhibit and movie downstairs. Be on time and other visitor attractions are close by to make a great day.

data.title: Hawaiian History
data.text: I've lived in Hawaii all my life and this past Saturday was the first time we visited Iolani Palace and I really have no words but rather something you need to experience.  We've read about the history, know about the monarchy but there is something to behold with the palace, with its architecture and every feature thoughtfully brought to life as you imagine what life was like back then.  Our Docent was well versed and knowledgeable with the history and there were very few questions as she covered quite amount of history in a short period of time.  If you're ever on Oahu, please make Iolani Palace one of your places to visit, you won't be sorry :-)

data.title: Nice place to visit
data.text: Good cultural experience and plenty to see.  Guided tours provide background of the islands and history of the culture.

data.title: Hawaiian royal history
data.text: We took a guided tour of the palace with a lovely guide called sue. She was very informative and knowledgeable about the history of the palace and the royal family. The palace was stunning and maintained to a high standard. A must if you are visiting honolulu

data.title: Beautiful historic property
data.text: I knew very little about Native Hawaiian history.  Iolani Palace helped fill in a few blanks.  This is a beautiful home & has a rich history--if you are interested at all in Hawaiian royalty, this is a must -see.  Interesting to see that Hawaiians had electricity before a lot of the rest of the world!

data.title: An different perspective of the authentic Hawai'i
data.text: I have visited numerous royal palaces around the world, but this one left me with a sense of bewilderment.  The Iolani Palace takes you to the era when Hawai'i was ruled by royals loved by their people, royals who shared a place of honor with their peers around the world. The place is gorgeous and the tour very informative and well done. There is more to Hawai'i than beautiful beaches, and this palace and its history underscore that fact.
